title: unused_import lint triggered when the item is used in documentation

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

```Rust
// The following import is not used in the code. However, it is used in the
// documentation for `_Useless`.
use std::borrow::Cow;

/// This is a doc comment
///
/// The [`Cow`] says moo.
struct _Useless;
```


### Current output

```Shell
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
warning: unused import: `std::borrow::Cow`
 --> src/lib.rs:3:5
  |
3 | use std::borrow::Cow;
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unused_imports)]` on by default

warning: `playground` (lib) generated 1 warning
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.59s
```


### Desired output

```Shell
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.48s
```


### Rationale and extra context

In this example, removing this import breaks the documentation, as it uses intra-doc links. As a result, `rustc` should not warn against unused import.

Perhaps `rustc` should parse the documentation in order to find usages of additional imported items.
